column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Evenki alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.

verb
  1. (transitive) to wash
  2. (intransitive) to bathe
  3. (transitive) to wipe
  4. (transitive) to get wet
  5. (transitive) to add

noun
  1. father, dad (used when addressing one's father)
  2. sleep

verb
  1. (intransitive) to sleep

verb
  1. (intransitive) to be born
  2. (intransitive) to live
  3. (intransitive) to bear (a child or young)
  4. (intransitive, of animals or plants) to grow

verb
  1. (copulative) to be
  2. (intransitive) to be
  3. (intransitive) to live

verb
  1. (intransitive) to be dying
  2. (transitive) to pet
  3. (transitive) to wash (clothes)
  4. (transitive) to smear
  5. (transitive) to smoothen; to straighten

verb
  1. (transitive) to catch (on a hunt)
  2. (transitive) to kill
  3. (transitive) to bruise (a limb)

verb
  1. (transitive) to take
  2. (transitive) to receive
  3. (transitive) to buy
  4. (transitive) to remove
  5. (intransitive) to use two poles to push oneself through water while sitting on the stern of a hunting canoe

verb
  1. (transitive) to ask; to beg
  2. (transitive) to demand
  3. (transitive) to wish; to want
  4. (transitive) to be bored

verb
  1. (transitive) to write
  2. (intransitive) to write
  3. (transitive) to copy

verb
  1. (transitive) to chop
  2. (transitive) to cleave (with one's chest)

verb
  1. (transitive) to strip off
  2. (transitive) to cook (make food)
  3. (transitive) to measure

verb
  1. (transitive) to enter
  2. (transitive) to hear
  3. (intransitive) to sound

verb
  1. (intransitive) to laugh
  2. (intransitive) to joke
  3. (intransitive) to jeer

verb
  1. (transitive) to bake; to fry
  2. (intransitive) to get a nervous breakdown

verb
  1. (transitive) to hang
  2. (transitive) to weigh
  3. (transitive) to put on (moccasins)

noun
  1. A type of summer moccasins.

verb
  1. (intransitive) to open; to open up
  2. (intransitive) to be open; to be uncorked

verb
  1. (transitive) to leave
  2. (transitive) to throw out
  3. (transitive) to lose
  4. (transitive) to overthrow

verb
  1. (transitive) to kindle
  2. (intransitive) to smoke
  3. (transitive) to remove hair from a pelt

verb
  1. (transitive) to put
  2. (transitive) to award
  3. (transitive) to accept
  4. (transitive) to elect
  5. (transitive) to drop
  6. (intransitive) to sweat

noun
  1. doe (wild female deer)

verb
  1. (transitive) to do
  2. (transitive) to make
  3. (transitive) to build
  4. (transitive) to solve
  5. (transitive) to devote
  6. (copulative) to become
  7. (intransitive) to appear
  8. (intransitive) to happen
  9. (intransitive) to come to
  10. (intransitive) to get better

verb

  1. (transitive) to extinguish

verb
  1. (transitive, intransitive) to read

noun
  1. sledge, sleigh, sled (a vehicle on runners, used for conveying loads over the snow or ice)

  1. (transitive) to put

verb
  1. (transitive) to feed
  2. (intransitive) to row; to paddle

verb
  1. (transitive) to spawn (roe)

  4. (transitive) to cook
  5. (transitive) to brew; to make (tea)
